column4: iceflatline: you obviously don't get satire... i'm using 11.04

read what i said again, and really put your thinking cap on
i dont get what you want
id on't want anything... you obviouskly didn't get it, and explaining it to you would just make you laugh at yourself.
yeah just stop your strange conversation here
i did.. you kept it up
the iso works, but installing from them requiers some workarounds... for instance, the alt. cd... since it errors out if it can't mount the CD, so you have to mount your USB as a cd.
why should the content of the iso mount itself again?

have you used the alternate cd, from USB.... i know the live cd's work, and presumably, the mini iso works
This step is only needed for the Alternate install CD and Ubuntu 6.10 or older.
dunno, it's never worked for me w/ any ubuntu distro...if it works for you guys, thats great.... but it dind't work for me w/ 11.04 either.
